title: Textile, 1800–1850
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed on plain weave
markings: Small copper tag attached to one corner, stamped on one side: "Regie Gabelle," on the other side: "Merci Stran" with caduceus of Mercury, and eagle with "29" on breast. Same corner stamped: "Au Bon Marché voile de genes."
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt
description: Mezzaro in a multicolored design on a white ground. Center shows a large-scale tree with many different blossoms. Small flanking tree on either side. Floral sprays, insects, birds and animals over the ground. Floral border with small inset landscapes with animals.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1800–1850.
1800–1850. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed on plain weave. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt. 1931-4-6.
